result.markdown:
::: {.question} **Expected Return without Leverage** A company has no debt. Its assets will be worth 606.6 million in one year if the economy is strong, but only 299.5 million if the economy is weak. Both events are equally likely. The current market value of the company’s assets is 399.4 million. Compute the **expected return without leverage (in %)**. ::: {.question-block}
✅ Expected return = (453 − 399.4) ÷ 399.4 = 13.4%.
::: :::
